name: time
description: A Pulumi package for creating and managing Time resources
attribution: This Pulumi package is based on the [`time` Terraform Provider](https://github.com/hashicorp/terraform-provider-time).

nodejs.packageDescription: A Pulumi package for creating and managing Time resources
nodejs.readme:
> This provider is a derived work of the [Terraform Provider](https://github.com/hashicorp/terraform-provider-time)
> distributed under [MPL 2.0](https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/MPL/2.0/). If you encounter a bug or missing feature,
> first check the [`pulumi/pulumi-time` repo](https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-time/issues); however, if that doesn't turn up anything,
> please consult the source [`hashicorp/terraform-provider-time` repo](https://github.com/hashicorp/terraform-provider-time/issues).

python.readme:
> This provider is a derived work of the [Terraform Provider](https://github.com/hashicorp/terraform-provider-time)
> distributed under [MPL 2.0](https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/MPL/2.0/). If you encounter a bug or missing feature,

provider.description:
The provider type for the time package. By default, resources use package-wide configuration
settings, however an explicit `Provider` instance may be created and passed during resource
construction to achieve fine-grained programmatic control over provider settings. See the
[documentation](https://www.pulumi.com/docs/reference/programming-model/#providers) for more information.

baseRfc3339.description:
Base timestamp in [RFC3339](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc3339#section-5.8) format (see [RFC3339 time
string](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.8) e.g., `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ`). Defaults to the current time.

offsetDays.description: Number of days to offset the base timestamp. At least one of the 'offset_' arguments must be configured.

offsetHours.description: Number of hours to offset the base timestamp. At least one of the 'offset_' arguments must be configured.

offsetMinutes.description: Number of minutes to offset the base timestamp. At least one of the 'offset_' arguments must be configured.

offsetMonths.description: Number of months to offset the base timestamp. At least one of the 'offset_' arguments must be configured.

offsetSeconds.description: Number of seconds to offset the base timestamp. At least one of the 'offset_' arguments must be configured.

offsetYears.description: Number of years to offset the base timestamp. At least one of the 'offset_' arguments must be configured.

rfc3339.description: RFC3339 format of the offset timestamp, e.g. `2020-02-12T06:36:13Z`.

triggers.description:
Arbitrary map of values that, when changed, will trigger a new base timestamp value to be saved. See [the main provider
documentation](../index.md) for more information.

unix.description: Number of seconds since epoch time, e.g. `1581489373`.

offsetYears.description: Number of years to offset the base timestamp. At least one of the 'offset_' arguments must be configured.

triggers.description:
Arbitrary map of values that, when changed, will trigger a new base timestamp value to be saved. See [the main provider

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering TimeOffset resources.

baseRfc3339.description:
Base timestamp in [RFC3339](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc3339#section-5.8) format (see [RFC3339 time
string](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.8) e.g., `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ`). Defaults to the current time.

offsetDays.description: Number of days to offset the base timestamp. At least one of the 'offset_' arguments must be configured.

offsetHours.description: Number of hours to offset the base timestamp. At least one of the 'offset_' arguments must be configured.

offsetMinutes.description: Number of minutes to offset the base timestamp. At least one of the 'offset_' arguments must be configured.

offsetMonths.description: Number of months to offset the base timestamp. At least one of the 'offset_' arguments must be configured.

offsetSeconds.description: Number of seconds to offset the base timestamp. At least one of the 'offset_' arguments must be configured.

offsetYears.description: Number of years to offset the base timestamp. At least one of the 'offset_' arguments must be configured.

rfc3339.description: RFC3339 format of the offset timestamp, e.g. `2020-02-12T06:36:13Z`.

documentation](../index.md) for more information.

unix.description: Number of seconds since epoch time, e.g. `1581489373`.

rfc3339.description:
Base timestamp in [RFC3339](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc3339#section-5.8) format (see [RFC3339 time
string](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.8) e.g., `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ`). Defaults to the current time.

rotationDays.description:
Number of days to add to the base timestamp to configure the rotation timestamp. When the current time has passed the
rotation timestamp, the resource will trigger recreation. At least one of the 'rotation_' arguments must be configured.

rotationHours.description:
Number of hours to add to the base timestamp to configure the rotation timestamp. When the current time has passed the
rotation timestamp, the resource will trigger recreation. At least one of the 'rotation_' arguments must be configured.

rotationMinutes.description:
Number of minutes to add to the base timestamp to configure the rotation timestamp. When the current time has passed the
rotation timestamp, the resource will trigger recreation. At least one of the 'rotation_' arguments must be configured.

rotationMonths.description:
Number of months to add to the base timestamp to configure the rotation timestamp. When the current time has passed the
rotation timestamp, the resource will trigger recreation. At least one of the 'rotation_' arguments must be configured.

rotationRfc3339.description:
Configure the rotation timestamp with an [RFC3339](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc3339#section-5.8) format of
the offset timestamp. When the current time has passed the rotation timestamp, the resource will trigger recreation. At
least one of the 'rotation_' arguments must be configured.

rotationYears.description:
Number of years to add to the base timestamp to configure the rotation timestamp. When the current time has passed the
rotation timestamp, the resource will trigger recreation. At least one of the 'rotation_' arguments must be configured.

triggers.description:
Arbitrary map of values that, when changed, will trigger a new base timestamp value to be saved. These conditions
recreate the resource in addition to other rotation arguments. See [the main provider documentation](../index.md) for
more information.

unix.description: Number of seconds since epoch time, e.g. `1581489373`.
